Because my opinion of the game is so similar to other reviews, let me word everything a little different. The publisher of this game is 505 Mobile Games. This game is a mobile game. The game wants you to connect to Facebook. Like many mobile games that try to get you to connect to Facebook, is plagued by the need to constantly pay to speed up building/upgrading process. That means that all of the game's mechanics are build around the idea of being as tedious and bothersome as possible to try to get some money. Of course many players will stop playing as soon as they realize what the game is all about but that's okay because these kind of developers are not interested in entertainment, they just want to get money. So if you don't want to pay, you are not the target of this game. It's almost impossible to recommend this game even to people that enjoy these kind of mechanics, because most of them probably have already 'invested' in another game like this one, and considering this game has nothing new to offer, they won't be interested in playing the same game they are playing but with different graphics.

This is the same as the mobile version, which makes the resolution a bit akward, and no advantage to using a computer. The game itself if okay, but still requires work. When I first started there were a lot more supplies to be had, now there is really no way to save enough to upgrade defences further. Example: I'm at level 65 with 2400 dog tags; I can only find around 200,000 supplies in an average battle (and even this takes a lot of searching), but it costs me 130,000 to deploy a full army, meaning I only net an average of 70,000 per battle, but need 3,200,000 to upgrade the hangar... If that's not bad enough; as soon as I save up 1,000,000 someone at level 120 with 2800 dog tags will come and take half. Because they take more than I can possibly earn in battle, I will never be able to upgrade beyond my current state. Also, AI is terrible, half of the time my soldiers just pace back and forth in the same spot until time runs out and I lose what would have been a winable match.

Many say that this game is another money grabber a pay to win game & yes they are correct in saying that to a degree BUT they only get your money if you choose to give it to them & if you enjoy the game for what it is then you are basically not paying to win but playing to enjoy.   ----- A Few Points -----  #1: The game has been labeled as a f2p so you choose weather or not to install & play it, you don't have a loaded gun against your head that's forcing you to do so, either play it or not its simple.  #2: I admit i have payed alittle of my own money to get an extra engineer & maybe a few quick upgrades but AGAIN thats players choice not the devs threatening your life if you dont, but you do get a few free gold (microtransaction currency) by completing some in-game achievements which is nice.  #3: This game has its moments & i have no complaints with it being a f2p but mere suggestions on what may need improving, yes it has its in-game issues for a few players and they can be very upsetting but thats because its a video game not a painting by Leonardoda vinci (refering to it being perfect :p)  #4: This is a browser style kind of game that you progress through with the aid of real time, for example: The command bunker level 3 upgrade (level 3 unlocks a nice selection of units) will take 24hours in real time to complete, yes its quite a wait but when you leave the game to do its work and go off to play something else it has the next stage ready for you to use when/if you return which to be honest i like but could do with a slight tweek here and there.  ----- Final Verdict -----  Battle Islands is a very fun small f2p game that has its moments and can be enjoyed by anyone, it may be a bit of a waiting game (literally) but can be played WITHOUT any microtransactions if one chooses.  Overall Score 8/10  Hope my little rant has helped in some way :D  ''See you on the battlefield'' (or not)
